page.title: 05BIRDS OF PREY (part 2)
page.content: {Buzzard The buzzard eats small mammals like mice,rabbits, shrews, voles and small birds.There are many in Strathnairn. They build their nests fifty feet or higher above ground level.Usually 2-4 eggs are laid. The nest is built about two months before the eggs are laid. They can fly up to 50 miles per hour. The chicks leave the nest after about 12 weeks. {Kestrel The female lays 4-5 white eggs with heavy reddish marking which she sits on for four weeks. The male gets food at first then then later on they both feed the chicks till they leave the nest.The adults are about pigeon size and will hunt down any mammals up to the size of a hare. A kestrel has been spotted around the school playground recently.
